# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

def wrap_string(text, text_width=10):
    """Wrap a string of words into lines with a maximum width."""
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in text.split():
        if len(current_line) + len(word) > text_width:
            lines.append(current_line)
            current_line = ""
        if current_line:
            current_line += " "
        current_line += word
    lines.append(current_line)
    return "\n".join(lines)

# Example usage:
print(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))

# Output:
This function will
wrap words into lines
